intro: Alsine baldaccii, commonly known as the baldaccii sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a small annual herb that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant features simple, alternate leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers with five petals. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. Alsine baldaccii is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to dry, coastal environments.
